page.title: 12TARNOCK VILLAGE
page.content: PARTLY SITUATED ON THE A38 AND PARTLY ON THE OLD ROAD,THIS IS A STRAGGLING HAMLET.IT DEPENDS LARGELY ON PASSING TRAFFIC FOR ITS EXISTANCE AND WHEN THE M5 OPENED,THEN THIS MAJOR EXISTENCE WAS THREATENED. LOCAL PEOPLE DEPEND ON THE GARAGE,RESTAURANT AND LOCAL FORMS FOR A LIVELYHOOD. MANY OF THE OLDER BUILDINGS DATE FROM THE 1850'S.THE BAPTIST CHAPEL WAS BUILT IN 1852 AND REFURBISHED AND EXTENDED IN 1887. WHAT VILLAGE LIFE STILL EXSISTS,DOES SO BECAUSE OF THE CHAPEL ND THE LOCAL 'PUB'THE NEW MOON NN.THERE IS NOTHING TO HOLD YOUNG PEOPLE TO THE AREA.
